intro: Grangea adansonii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring small, opposite leaves and yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savannas and woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
